Biodegradable materials: If all plastic disappeared, we could use biodegradable materials such as bamboo, hemp, and corn starch. These materials are sustainable, renewable, and can decompose naturally without harming the environment.
Glass and metal: We could also use glass and metal containers instead of plastic. These materials are durable, reusable, and can be recycled.
Paper and cardboard: Paper and cardboard are also great alternatives to plastic. They are biodegradable, renewable, and can be recycled.

Natural fibers: Natural fibers such as cotton, linen, and jute can be used to make bags, clothing, and other products that would typically be made of plastic. These materials are biodegradable, renewable, and can be woven or knitted.

Edible packaging: Edible packaging made from seaweed, algae, and other plant-based materials could also be used instead of plastic. These materials are biodegradable, renewable, and can be consumed as part of our diet.
